issue.title: #12023 Add GitHub security policy
issue.body:
## Scope and purpose

Fixes #12023


Right now the main "Security" page for twisted/twisted looks like


![image](https://github.com/twisted/twisted/assets/204609/278314a7-5c41-4ac3-8056-c76a3aab335a)


We would like have the security info right away. something like electron

![image](https://github.com/twisted/twisted/assets/204609/f9e20d94-0c28-40cf-84af-4b5f392ccece)

----------

In order to actual see the result of this PR, it needs to be merged

You can view the content of the file at https://github.com/twisted/twisted/blob/12023-github-security-policy/.SECURITY.md

comment.body:
As we try to receive money from Tidelift, for each CVE we will need to answer to these questions:

* Does this vulnerability still apply when the package is only used as a build tool or dev/test dependency? YES | NO
* Does this vulnerability apply only if certain methods, classes, or functionality are in use? YES | NO
* Please list the affected classes, methods, functionality: TEXTARE
* Are there any other conditions that users should check for to determine if they're vulnerable? YES|NO
* Please describe the conditions users should check for: TEXTAREA
* For users who are unable to upgrade to a supported release, is there a workaround available? YES | NO
* When using the package as intended, how likely is it that users are affected by this vulnerability? Scale 0 - 10 (0 not likely - 10 highly likely)
* Please explain: TEXTAREA
* Please select the releases affected by this vulnerability. CHECKBOXES

---------

I see that for previous CVEs (Twisted releases), someone from Tidelift has already answered these questions.

-----------

I think that the questions are reasonable, and we might want include them in the release notes for a security issue.

issue.title: #12023 Add GitHub security policy
issue.body:
## Scope and purpose

Fixes #12023


Right now the main "Security" page for twisted/twisted looks like


![image](https://github.com/twisted/twisted/assets/204609/278314a7-5c41-4ac3-8056-c76a3aab335a)


We would like have the security info right away. something like electron

![image](https://github.com/twisted/twisted/assets/204609/f9e20d94-0c28-40cf-84af-4b5f392ccece)

----------

In order to actual see the result of this PR, it needs to be merged

You can view the content of the file at https://github.com/twisted/twisted/blob/12023-github-security-policy/.SECURITY.md

comment.body:
The rename is done.

My suggetion is to keep SECURITY.MD brief.

Just inform that security reports should be done by clicking the button from top right.

Inform that no public ticket or public PR should be made for this issue, and that the GitHub process will handle the privacy.

Also provide a link to the security.rst full docs.

What do you think?

issue.title: `constantly` needs some help to move to py3.12
issue.body:
I know it might not be the right place, but `constantly` project need some help to get into py3.12 (it would affect lots of downstream usage)

relates to:
- https://github.com/twisted/constantly/issues/29

Currently, there is some PR patch for py3.12 config change, https://github.com/twisted/constantly/pull/31

issue.title: `constantly` needs some help to move to py3.12
issue.body:
I know it might not be the right place, but `constantly` project need some help to get into py3.12 (it would affect lots of downstream usage)

relates to:
- https://github.com/twisted/constantly/issues/29

Currently, there is some PR patch for py3.12 config change, https://github.com/twisted/constantly/pull/31

comment.body:
> I think that twisted is already using constantly on py 3.12 ... and it works.

I believe that the issue here has to do with the fact that Homebrew wants to do a source build, and while constantly works fine from its universal wheel, the bundled `versioneer` that runs at build time is not compatible with 3.12 and is causing build issues.

In any case this has nothing to do with twisted/twisted, so I'm closing here, but the issue should definitely be addressed.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,11 +1,16 @@
 Report a security issue
 =======================
 
+..
+  ATTENTION: For GitHub UI we also have /SECURITY.md file, which is a Markdown conversion of this file.
+  When making changes to this make, make sure to also update /SECURITY.md.
comment.body:
```suggestion
  ATTENTION: This is the reStructuredText version of /.SECURITY.md. Any changes should also be made in the Markdown version.
```

issue.title: `constantly` needs some help to move to py3.12
issue.body:
I know it might not be the right place, but `constantly` project need some help to get into py3.12 (it would affect lots of downstream usage)

relates to:
- https://github.com/twisted/constantly/issues/29

Currently, there is some PR patch for py3.12 config change, https://github.com/twisted/constantly/pull/31

comment.body:
Thanks for the heads up.

I think that twisted is already using constantly on py 3.12 ... and it works.

But there might be things not working.


continue the work for fixing this on https://github.com/twisted/constantly/pull/31

--------

Not sure if for Twisted we want to do the upgrade


I will leave this open for now, as maybe we might want to upgrade constantly, once the new release is done.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,11 +1,16 @@
 Report a security issue
 =======================
 
+..
+  ATTENTION: For GitHub UI we also have /SECURITY.md file, which is a Markdown conversion of this file.
+  When making changes to this make, make sure to also update /SECURITY.md.
+
 We take security very seriously.
 Your input and feedback on our security is always appreciated.
 
-You can send urgent or sensitive reports directly to security@twistedmatrix.com
+You can send urgent or sensitive reports via `GitHub Security Advisory <https://github.com/twisted/twisted/security/advisories/new>`_.
comment.body:
I think that we should also add a big warning at the start of this document, to mention that any security PR should be done via private repos using the GitHub functionalty.


Otherwise, by creating a normal PR the bug is disclosed before the fix being ready :)

issue.title: Update security policy link in GItHub.com
issue.body:
In the past, GitHub was happy to consider our `/docs/security.rst` as the security policy.

It looks like now, it wants `/SECURITY.md`

Since  we use GitHub for security bug reporting and fixing via private .

Also, add a note in the release process to make sure we alwasy have a CVE for any security bug.

comment.body:
From https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/getting-started/adding-a-security-policy-to-your-repository

```
To give people instructions for reporting security vulnerabilities in your project, you can add a SECURITY.md file to your repository's root, docs, or .github folder. When someone creates an issue in your repository, they will see a link to your project's security policy.
```

issue.title: Update security policy link in GItHub.com
issue.body:
In the past, GitHub was happy to consider our `/docs/security.rst` as the security policy.

It looks like now, it wants `/SECURITY.md`

Since  we use GitHub for security bug reporting and fixing via private .

Also, add a note in the release process to make sure we alwasy have a CVE for any security bug.

Follow the steps from https://docs.twisted.org/en/latest/development/release-process.html
